This boilerplate was created to serve as a base project for a quick start of an API in .NET, with a structured architecture opened for scalability and easy to maintenance. Its conception results in previous episodes where new developments emerged and the need to have an empty project with basic configurations already defined was felt.
Below is a list of basic features that this boilerplate API offers:
- Structured architecture based on layers
- API request examples
- Log events using Serilog
- FluentValidation
- Unit test examples in xUnit

sectionDescription.title: Contribution
description: Was responsible for designing and creating the boilerplate from scratch, choosing the architecture and packages needed for it, as well as basic features it needed to offer.

sectionDescription.title: Technical Sheet
description: Technologies involved on this project:
- .NET 5
- xUnit
- Onion Architecture
- Serilog
- FluentValidation
- FluentAssertions
- Moq
- Dapper ORM
- Swagger
For a more detailed explanation of the chosen architecture and its layers or to start using this boilerplate, go to its git repository by clicking in the button below.
